# Test the Check Component

This runbook demonstrates the Check component with different exit code scenarios.

## Exit Code Convention

Check scripts use standard exit codes to indicate their status:
- **Exit 0**: Success ‚úÖ
- **Exit 2**: Warning ‚ö†Ô∏è
- **Exit 1 (or any other)**: Failure ‚ùå

## Example 1: Success Check

This check demonstrates a successful validation (exit code 0):

<Check 
  id="check-success" 
  path="checks/check-success.sh" 
  successMessage="All checks passed! üéâ" 
  warnMessage="Warning detected" 
  failMessage="Check failed" 
/>

## Example 2: Warning Check

This check demonstrates a validation that passes with warnings (exit code 2):

<Check 
  id="check-warning" 
  path="checks/check-warning.sh" 
  successMessage="Success!" 
  warnMessage="Validation passed but with warnings" 
  failMessage="Check failed" 
/>

## Example 3: Failure Check

This check demonstrates a failed validation (exit code 1):

<Check 
  id="check-failure" 
  path="checks/check-failure.sh" 
  successMessage="Success!" 
  warnMessage="Warning detected" 
  failMessage="Validation failed - please fix the errors above ‚ùå" 
/>

## Example 4: Complex KMS Validation

This is a more realistic example checking AWS KMS configuration:

<Check 
  id="kms-validation" 
  path="checks/test.sh" 
  successMessage="KMS key is properly configured! ‚úÖ" 
  warnMessage="KMS key is accessible but with warnings ‚ö†Ô∏è" 
  failMessage="KMS key validation failed ‚ùå" 
/>
